datasets.name: Adult (Census Income)
datasets.description: Prediction of whether income exceeds $50K/yr based on census data. Also known as 'Census Income' dataset.

datasets.name: Loan Default (Default of Credit Card Clients)
datasets.description: Predict default payment of credit card clients in Taiwan.

datasets.name: Online Shoppers Purchasing Intention
datasets.description: Dataset consists of feature vectors belonging to 12,330 sessions. The dataset was formed so that each session would belong to a different user in a 1-year period to avoid any tendency to a specific campaign, special day, user profile, or period.

datasets.name: German Credit
datasets.description: Classifies people described by a set of attributes as good or bad credit risks.

datasets.name: Predict Students' Dropout and Academic Success
datasets.description: A dataset created from a higher education institution (acquired from several disjoint databases) related to students enrolled in different undergraduate degrees, such as agronomy, design, education, nursing, journalism, management, social service, and technologies.

datasets.name: MAGIC Gamma Telescope
datasets.description: Data are MC generated to simulate registration of high energy gamma particles in a ground-based atmospheric Cherenkov gamma telescope using the imaging technique.

datasets.name: Beijing PM2.5
datasets.description: Hourly PM2.5 data from US Embassy in Beijing. Used to predict pollution levels.

datasets.name: Online News Popularity
datasets.description: Articles published by Mashable. Predicts the number of shares in social networks.

content.impact: Models like GANs tend to suffer from 'mode collapse', ignoring minority classes entirely. Diffusion models (like DiffuTabGen) are more robust but still biased towards the mean. The paper notes: 'when the constraint deviates significantly from the empirical mean... the model continues to generate samples clustered around the original mean.' Highly imbalanced datasets (like default/shoppers) make it harder to generate high-fidelity minority samples.

Sparsity (missing values) usually requires imputation which introduces noise. High Cardinality in categorical columns (e.g. Zip Code) is challenging because 'Analog Bit' encoding (used in DiffuTabGen) imposes an artificial geometry/ordering on categories. Complex, high-dimensional discrete manifolds are harder for the diffusion process to learn than continuous dense ones.

The paper highlights that 'when the target mean is set to a value that lies at the extreme ends (left or right tail)... guided diffusion struggles.' Datasets with heavy tails or outliers (like financial data in Loan Default) are harder to model accurately than normally distributed data.

papers.title: TabDiffuGEN: Guided Diffusion for Synthetic Tabular Data Generation with User-Specified Constraints
papers.authors: Lakshay Kakkar, N. Rajasekhar Reddy, Srikanta Bedathur

papers.title: TabSYN: Modeling Tabular Data with Diffusion Models
